Reviews.Title: Surprised by feature-laden camera!
Reviews.Author: Oji John "Oji"
Reviews.Content: Yes, feature-laden camera the size of the palm of my hand.  We've been agonizing over which of today's modern home security cameras we could purchase to replace the old VEOs we've used for years.We read an article in a magazine which mentioned Sharx as a possible solution, so we decided to take a look at its website.We were encouraged enough to order one of the Sharx SCN2607W indoor cameras.  After trying it out for a spell, we can relate what we like about it:-> Manual = well-written.  Kudos to the tech writer!-> We can set up a camera using LINUX which is our primary operating system at home.  Yes, we can use a Mac or a PC, too.-> We can use the camera's wireless functions or we can hook the camera directly to our home CAT5/6 network. We tried both and had no problems.-> We can have images emailed to our ISP email account (e.g. Yahoo! or Gmail).-> We can monitor the camera with our Smartphone, Touch or any browser at any internet cafe in the world (where politics allow it ;-).-> If we want to archive images/video, we can use a computer already on the home network to receive files for storage.  We *don't* need a separate digital video recorder (DVR) or network-attached storage (NAS) as part of a package to store images or video files generated by the camera.-> OR, we can insert a MicroSD card which the camera will manage for us by overwriting the oldest file if the card is about full.  If we don't want to lose a file from the card, we can ask the camera to send the files to whatever storage device we're using on the home network.-> If you know how to set one up, your home network storage device can be an ftp or http server.  Maybe you already subscribe to an ISP that lets you ftp or http files to remote storage.  You can send your files there.-> The point of much of the above is: maybe you already have the basics of home security video monitoring - you just lack a good camera.  This is an excellent camera!-> The built-in motion detector works fine.  We can adjust the sensitivity and threshold with Firefox running on LINUX but an ActiveX add-on for IE7 provides an additional GUI flourish that's nice to have.-> Video resolution, frame rate, etc., are adjustable.  Various streams are available from the camera to suit different viewing/receiving/storage devices.  For instance, there's a stream available that's suitable for a mobile phone. (This feature we have not tried yet. . .)-> The IR LEDs light up a large room at night.-> The camera comes with a mounting bracket that you don't have to mount.  Just set it on a shelf and it won't fall over!  Don't like where you put it the first time?  Pick it up and move it (which illustrates one of the advantages of the WiFi feature!)-> Sharx' *outdoor* cameras have an additional interface that can send/receive triggering signals to/from professionally installed security systems (e.g. window breaking sensors, perimeter intrusion, etc.)That's all we've had time to investigate in one evening.  There are more features we'd like to investigate, but we're impressed by the camera so far.  We've decided this is our solution and will order more of the cameras.

Reviews.Title: Customer support, set-up issues and limitations of use
Reviews.Author: John Haldeman
Reviews.Content: First, in a phone call, SHARX assured me that the VIPcella-IR SCNC2607W has the same technical specifications as the VIPcella-IR SCNC2607 except that one is black and the other is white.  The only difference with the other model (VIPcella SCNC2606) is that the 2606 models do not have infrared lights for night vision.  The rest of the electronics, set-up etc are all identical.  Therefore, virtually all of the customer comments made about the other SHARX cameras apply to this camera as well.My initial problem with purchasing from SHARX was the very poor website.  As of August 30, 2010, there was no contact phone number, no manual to download, no specific technical information, no help with set-up issues.  Just an e-mail.  This bothered me as it did not inspire confidence that the vendor will provide adequate support for the product.  This concern was proven wrong. As mentioned by others, in spite of the poor web site, the actual customer support is outstanding.I received a shipment that was incomplete, I emailed SHARX customer support and within a few hours someone called me back, worked out the problem and then stayed on line patiently for over an hour to help me set up the camera till I was satisfied.I learned a lot about the set-up process during that one hour interaction.  Basically, from the cable modem, I connect to a router and one of the router ports connects further into an Apple Airport Extreme WiFi station.  If my router and WiFi station would have been the latest models with all the new automatic features  (such as UPNP), the camera would have set itself up almost without any sophisticated user interaction.  In my case, the router was from 2005 (Ancient stuff as far as computer equipment is concerned), and my Apple WiFi station was an older model for which no further firmware upgrades were available.Because of this situation, set up of the camera was a quite complex. Without help from someone knowledgeable in networking, it would have been impossible for even a relatively experienced computer user to get this camera (or any other camera) to work. The SHARX technical representative knew exactly what he was doing and got me through this process with great skill and with a helpful and patient attitude.  It was actually a pleasure to work with this person on the set-up.This experience solved one of the great puzzles in my mind:  How come that some people reported that set up was easy while others reported such frustrating experiences and couldn't get it to work?  I think the answer is that there is nothing wrong with the camera - the problem is that the more outdated and unusual the individual cable modem and router configurations are, the more difficult it will be to set up the camera.In summary, once the camera was up, it performed exactly as advertised.  I love the ease of using the many features of the camera, the manual is very well written, and the camera provides relatively good images AT CLOSE RANGE.HOWEVER, there is a limitation:  This is NOT a professional security camera.  In case of a break-in, for example, the video and images produced by the camera will most probably NOT allow police to identify the intruder based on facial recognition unless the intruder directly looks into the camera at close range. If the subject moves fast or is more than 3 yards from the camera, the image will be rather blurry.  Further, all WiFi equipment can be rendered useless by a WiFi jammer that is readily available to potential intruders. In short, this is a great product to watch the baby or the cleaning lady, but it is not designed to be a robust home security system.

Reviews.Title: Pink Grass Pink Trees Pink Shrubs
Reviews.Author: MM
Reviews.Content: Everything is great about this camera except one thing.  The color rendering is terrible.  Due to its missing an ICR filter, my entire garden of green grass and trees becomes pink with this camera.  A person wearing a blue shirt, black pants, and black shoes appears uniformly a pastel purple.  Absolutely useless for providing suspect identification in a security application.  The worst part about this camera is the documentation that does not admit to this color rendering failure until page 20 in the manual.  Perhaps this nugget of information should be in bold type, upfront, before the sale.  Needless to say, I returned the camera the next day.  The rule of thumb is, if a camera has IR illuminators, make sure it has an automatic mechanical ICR filter.

Reviews.Title: Excellent do-it-yourself security
Reviews.Author: Horatio
Reviews.Content: Great camera and easy to use, but even if you run into troubles, the manual and the Sharx e-mail service is fantastic.  It's nice to be able to talk to someone who is so knowledgeable about their product.  The manual is well-written, very in-depth and it really helps when trying out all of the features.  I ran into one question about my network (not about the camera), and the Sharx tech-support people walked me right through it via email.With regard to the camera, it works well, but due to the IR capabilities, the colors are off a little bit. That doesn't bother me too much because I'm looking for good, clear security camera images. I don't need National Geographic photo quality.All in all a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: I've tried other cams.  This one is solid.
Reviews.Author: Stephen Curtis Lasseter
Reviews.Content: Solid hardware.  Nothing feels cheap or breakable.  Setup is easy.  The night-vision is great.  I've not had any problems with the wireless.  I now plan to by their outdoor product.  I'm using the cameras with the software called "SecuritySpy".  Everything just works.--- Many months later ----This cam is still great.  I ended up buying an addition one.  I've had over a year and a half use out of the first one and it is still solid.  Great quility, no fuss, no requirement to run microsoft products of any kind.

Reviews.Title: 6 STARS: Sharx Security VIPcella-IR SCNC2607W Wifi IP Network Camera; builtin MicroSD DVR WITH IR lite/sold by securcam./
Reviews.Author: xyz123
Reviews.Content: 6 STARS: Sharx Security VIPcella-IR SCNC2607W Wifi IP Network Camera; builtin MicroSD DVR WITH IR lite/sold by securcam.UPdaTe: june 14,2011; i bought six so far, all work!!!!!securcam.com gives excellent email response to anyquestion within a day!!!my original reView:EXCELLENT !!!!!excellent quality and superb pic.setup took 3 hours maximum .[3hours means=install on wall +computer setup for online viewing];compared to other sytems that took days ANDstill did not work.will buy next one via amazon [free shipping].would recommend.securcam emailed me a software answer within 24hours!!!BUY THIS CAM !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Hank
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific camera.  The instruction book is well written. Easy to install, especially if you are using apple wireless. Customer assistance is very responsive by email. They actually help you.If you are looking for a camera for home or office, one that doesn't need cables, etc. and one that has motion detectors, infra-red viewing, remote access and the ability to send email alerts with a snapshot - then this is your camera.I looked around at a lot of cameras. I zeroed in on this one. Look at the live demo on their web site. I love the ability to view the camera picture from my smartphone.A+ all around.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, easy setup
Reviews.Author: B. OLuanaigh
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews but my experience with this camera was so painless that I felt I should share. Network issues usually have me pulling my hair out but I had this camera up and running in about 90 minutes thanks to the thorough documentation and step-by-step instructions. By up and running I don't mean simply that it was powered up, it is working wirelessly and (again thanks to the documentation) I could access the camera through the web and on my iPhone. Port-forwarding was never so easy.

Reviews.Title: Better alternatives.
Reviews.Author: M. Hsu
Reviews.Content: This item is well made but is outperformed by many newer cameras at much better price points.  Consider the foscam series but prepare yourself for some time spent learning about your network.

Reviews.Title: Works Really Well.
Reviews.Author: D. MacInnis "Mac"
Reviews.Content: After reviewing numerous security cameras to an exhausting end, I selected this one.  It isn't the least expensive by any means.  But I wanted a camera that would record a video stream to a NAS (network storage), had excellent night vision, would send email alerts complete with photos of what it was seeing, and I could remotely control it via the internet from anywhere.  I don't use a 3G or 4G phone, but it will also send photos to these devices if programmed to do so.  From a computer knowledge perspective, I consider myself to be in the upper 1/3 of people that know what they are doing and with that said, setting up this camera can be just a little more difficult than average.  The plus side is that I made telephone contact with their tech person via the phone number provided and the one problem I had was solved inside of 15 seconds.  If I had to do this all over again, I wouldn't choose anything less than this Sharx Security camera.  It is a high capability video device that represents current state-of-the-art technology, and I want nothing less.

Reviews.Title: Best tech support EVER
Reviews.Author: JanB
Reviews.Content: Tech support are local, knowledgeable, patient, polite = four BIG ones.  This is not a "use-out-of-the-box" product or "plug and play."  It requires a lot of steps to get it up and running.  Following the book was not easy going in, BUT tech support emailed AND called me to resolve my setup issues each time I ran into something new.  My dog has little time to live and it was important to me to get the camera up and running, and accessible anywhere from my iPhone to keep an "eye" on him.  I have not been able to access sound.  The live video quality is okay, and the snapshots taken by motion detection are okay -- not "digital-camera" quality, but good enough to see who, what, where.  All that, combined with the BEST TECH SUPPORT EVER, make this a 5-star product for me.

Reviews.Title: One Terrific Camera
Reviews.Author: WFTjr
Reviews.Content: Set up was a breeze as long as you read the instructions first. I had it wireless in 5 minutes. The image quality is excellent as is its ease of use. Its kind of pricey but you really get what you pay for with this first rate camera. My set up was so easy because I have a relatively new router (Netgear N600) that did it all for me.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: ER
Reviews.Content: I bought Sharx SCNC2606, and Sharx SCNC2607, and SCNC2607W over six months ago. This review is for all of them. The cameras work as advertised and I can describe them all as AMAZING products. I'm not a tech savvy, but I followed the well written manual until I got them all working without a hitch, utilizing almost every single feature including saving to a NAS drive. Their incredible customer service is a different story. I had issues at first saving to my NAS drive, because of the way I set up my NAS, not because of the cameras, but Sharx customer service walked me through the NAS set up and the problems were solved. Never told me contact the NAS drive manufacturer. You can sense how well driven they are to make the Sharx products successful.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Ugh
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend.  Integrates well with Apple products.  Night vision quality is amazing.  Outdoor camera is excellent too.

Reviews.Title: Very good IP camera
Reviews.Author: mathie
Reviews.Content: Love the feature set (firmware 4.20). Had some problem with the wifi setup (due to the fact I was moving the camera a little and it lost signal). You can use CNAME to forward your own subdomain and get an easier-to-remember hostname when using DDNS. Here is my setup: motion detection via email, upload via FTP, use Minishowcase script to browse the uploaded images with ease. I'll buy a MicroSD card to record video when motion detected and upload those archived videos to FTP to free up MicroSd card's space. Good Buy! Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Don't be put off by the price
Reviews.Author: M. Hilbush
Reviews.Content: As the title says, don't be put off by the price of this camera.  Compared to other wireless IP cameras, this one is a bit on the high side.  But, IMO, it's worth every bit of the price.  Setup was a breeze -- I had this up and running within a few minutes.  Setup on my wireless network was a snap.  And, streaming to my Moto DroidX over the Internet works great.  However, make sure you follow the router setup directions carefully, as the proper port forwarding configuration is essential to be able to stream to you mobile phone over the Internet.

Reviews.Title: Superb Camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew D. Naselli "Andy Naselli"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are impressed with this video camera and wishing that we would have bought it sooner.This video camera meets our criteria:1. We wanted to mount it in our children's room (where there is no computer, modem, or router) so that we can check on them, especially when they're sleeping (or supposed to be sleeping!).2. We wanted to be able to view the video on a computer, iPhone, and iPod Touch.3. We wanted the camera to have a clear picture regardless of the lighting in the room.Yesterday I installed the camera in a few hours; it's not hard to do if you follow the detailed instructions.(BTW, don't forget to remove the transparent protective film over the lens. Some people in the past have reported a fuzzy image because they accidentally left that on.)I emailed a question to info@sharxsecurity.com this morning (a Saturday), and I promptly received a warm, generous reply that far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Great product.. even better service
Reviews.Author: Fernando A Corso Masias
Reviews.Content: The product is good, solid good. As with any decent quality wireless camera configuration can be difficult but that is what made the difference to me. The Sharx customer service really went above and beyond. Response time is hours at the most (email sent late at night), and always with the correct answers. I usually don;t write reviews but in this case my recommendation goes to Sharx.

Reviews.Title: great product tuff to install
Reviews.Author: Eric DiLauro
Reviews.Content: If your not computer savy you will have a hard time. My friend hooked it up easily but he is a computer genius!!!

Reviews.Title: Amazingly easy set up - customer support
Reviews.Author: Robert P. Cornella
Reviews.Content: As previously stated by others, after reading the manual (which I rarely do, but I am not totally comfortable with networking), the set up and desired functionality were a breeze!  Had it up and running day and night with home networking, phone and internet availability in no time.  Excellent on all aspects.  Also, as previously stated, the web site is very poor; however, I contacted customer service with a question about which MicroSD would work (High Capacity and Class questions) and literally within minutes, I had an email answer which was written by an individual and very complete!  Because of all the above, I would very highly recommend this product!!!

Reviews.Title: An amazing third eye!
Reviews.Author: Rolly Plata
Reviews.Content: I come from the Philippines but I work in China and stay there together with my family. Whenever I visit the US for business meetings, I make sure I browse Amazon.com before my trip. I am always interested to see if there are new electronic gadgets being sold. Since some of the new items are not available for shipping to locations outside of the US, I normally have them shipped to the hotel where I stay.In my last trip to the US in Aug'10, I found this item "Sharx Security VIPcella-IR SCNC2607W Wifi Wireless IP Network Camera." After reading the product features and the available review (I remember there was only one then), I decided to purchase the item. It was delivered on time to the hotel where I stayed and I brought it back home.Now I have installed this gadget in my home in the Philippines. It was very easy to install as long as you follow the instructions in the user manual. There is always a solution to any problem that may come up during the installation. For my installation, it was a breeze though as I read the user manual first. This gadget comes with an international voltage AC adapter (110V-240V) so I do not have to use a voltage transformer and I do not have to worry about accidentally damaging the unit in case I plug it in the wrong power outlet (both China & Philippines have 220-240V power supply).After the initial installation and when the wireless mode is already in operation, I accessed it using the assigned internet URL and, lo and behold, there was my living room and main gate and main door "live" on video. The unit also picks up sounds and you could hear conversations of people in the area. Pictures and videos are clear and the audio quality is very good. The night vision mode also works well. There are other features but you can try them later after the initial installation.So now even if I work in China, I can monitor my home in the Philippines and see what is happening there 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. An amazing third eye indeed! I highly recommend this gadget.
